reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The project is a continuation of the previous one dealing with the implementation of the Forest Rights Act 2006. During the previous phase the central activities were the preparation and submission of the forest rights claim forms. The present project will be a continuation of the same with additionally more focused programmes on different aspects of Community Forest Governance (CFG), emphasizing on popular assertion of forest rights with or without the Title of Community Forest Rights (CFR). This phase wil l include both vigorous efforts to submit CFR claim forms on the one hand, and up gradation of the ongoing CFG efforts by including two new ingredients, namely, access to potential government funding for the CFG and marketing of Minor Forest Produces (MFPs ) on the other. The Rule 16 of the FRA directs all the state government departments to fund the CFG but there has not been much progress in making any funds available for the purpose. In the marketing of the MFPs there are legal obstacles that should have been removed when FRA 2006 came into being but they are still prevailing. The gathering and marketing of forest produces and value addition to the products will be supported by promotion of women´s cooperative, among other things. Environmental awareness building among the youth will be continued, too. The primary focus of the project will be the same 200 villages that were focussed during the previous project phase. However, more and more villages are becoming eager to join the JJBA efforts, and some of t hem may be taken up as an addition to the existing villages. Networking at the Jharkhand state and all India level with other relevant movements and groups in the field of CFG will be emphasized very strongly, like engagement with the state government for speedier implementation of the FRA. www.birsa.in
